name: Porchetta
keywords: Italian cuisine, pork belly, roasted pork, herbs, spices, fennel seeds, rosemary, sage, orange zest, pine nuts, crispy skin, main course, family meal, special occasion, oven-baked, savory, flavorful, easy recipe, make-ahead, sandwich filling, salad topping
description: Super rich crispy pork belly rolled up with the best of the best herbs/spices/seasoning inside.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 150C. Before seasining, roll it up and cut off any extra skin that would end up being rolled inside.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut excess skin

recipeInstructions.text: Deeply score the meat side of the pork in a diamond pattern and rub generous amounts of seasoning into the meats.
recipeInstructions.name: Season pork

recipeInstructions.text: Roll and tie it up as tightly as you can. Pour a jug of boiling water over it (over the sink) to dry out the skin. Score the skin and rub salt into it.
recipeInstructions.name: Roll and prep

recipeInstructions.text: Bake in the oven on a wire rack over a tray to catch the drippings, there will be alot. Bake for 2-3h until cooked through. If required, crank the oven to 220C at the end to crisp up the skin.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook

notes: Amazing way to have pork belly and incredibly versatile. I love it on a sandwich but it's also great cut up and tossed through a fresh salad.
